intro: Drimys winteri var. quinoensis, commonly known as the Quinoan winter's bark, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the family Winteraceae, which is one of the oldest families of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are elliptical and have a leathery texture. It produces small, white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, followed by berries that are edible but have a sharp, acidic taste. The species is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in humid, temperate climates.
